comments:
C:\Aperi\configure>cfgaperi easy
[Fatal Error] :6:172: The reference to entity "big_mirror" must end with the ';' delimiter.
Error while loading the third party software configuration.
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The reference to entity "big_mirror" must end with the ';' delimiter.
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DOMParser.parse(Unknown Source)
        at org.eclipse.aperi.download.DownloadConfig.loadConfig(DownloadConfig.java:80)
        at org.eclipse.aperi.download.DownloadConfig.<init>(DownloadConfig.java:47)
        at org.eclipse.aperi.configure.ConfigureAperi.load3rdPartyConfiguration(ConfigureAperi.java:2010)
        at org.eclipse.aperi.configure.ConfigureAperi.configureAperi(ConfigureAperi.java:154)
        at org.eclipse.aperi.configure.ConfigureAperi.main(ConfigureAperi.java:137)

C:\Aperi\configure>doit "C:\Documents and Settings\Administrator\Desktop\aperi-20070504-144338.zip"

It's fixed now, but here is the workaround:
replace
   http://downloads.sourceforge.net/itext/itext-1.3.jar?modtime=1112806930&big_mirror=0
with
   http://downloads.sourceforge.net/itext/itext-1.3.jar
in download.xml

I got further with the workaround and ran into this on the agent launch:

The data server didn't start:
Exception in thread "Thread-1" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: C:\Aperi\lib\w32-ix86\DataLog.dll: Access is denied
	at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1751)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1676)
	at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:822)
	at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:992)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.logging.NativeLogManager.initServerTraceLogger(NativeLogManager.java:682)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.server.Server.main(Server.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.aperi.server.DataServerActivator$DataServerThread.run(DataServerActivator.java:57)

I wasn't able to reproduce this problem on the same machine where it was reopened.  I think the access problem is due to Windows access restrictions caused by the script used for automated build testing.  See the C:\aperi-20070504-144338\ directory on the same machine for details.
After the workaround, it seems OK now. I don't know why launching data server, it needs MSVCRTD.dll, I have to copy it from other windows system to \windows\system32 to make it work
